measure.name: preheating
measure.description: This measure adjusts heating schedules by a user specified number of degrees for the specified time period of a day. User can also specify the start and end date for the adjustment. This is applied throughout the entire building.
measure.modeler_description: This measure will clone all of the schedules that are used as heating setpoints for thermal zones. The clones are hooked up to the thermostat in place of the original schedules. Then the schedules are adjusted by the specified values. HVAC operation schedule will also be changed.

argument.name: heating_adjustment
argument.display_name: Degrees Fahrenheit to Adjust Heating Setpoint By
argument.description: Use positive value for increasing heating setpoint during preheating period

argument.name: start_date1
argument.display_name: First start date for preheating

argument.name: end_date1
argument.display_name: First end date for preheating

argument.name: start_date2
argument.display_name: Second start date for preheating (optional)
argument.description: Specify a date in MM-DD format if you want a second season of preheating; leave blank if not needed.

argument.name: end_date2
argument.display_name: Second end date for preheating
argument.description: Specify a date in MM-DD format if you want a second season of preheating; leave blank if not needed. If either the start or end date is blank, the period is considered not used.

argument.name: start_date3
argument.display_name: Third start date for preheating (optional)
argument.description: Specify a date in MM-DD format if you want a third season of preheating; leave blank if not needed.

argument.name: end_date3
argument.display_name: Third end date for preheating
argument.description: Specify a date in MM-DD format if you want a third season of preheating; leave blank if not needed. If either the start or end date is blank, the period is considered not used.

argument.name: start_date4
argument.display_name: Fourth start date for preheating (optional)
argument.description: Specify a date in MM-DD format if you want a fourth season of preheating; leave blank if not needed.

argument.name: end_date4
argument.display_name: Fourth end date for preheating
argument.description: Specify a date in MM-DD format if you want a fourth season of preheating; leave blank if not needed. If either the start or end date is blank, the period is considered not used.

argument.name: start_date5
argument.display_name: Fifth start date for preheating (optional)
argument.description: Specify a date in MM-DD format if you want a fifth season of preheating; leave blank if not needed.

argument.name: end_date5
argument.display_name: Fifth end date for preheating
argument.description: Specify a date in MM-DD format if you want a fifth season of preheating; leave blank if not needed. If either the start or end date is blank, the period is considered not used.

argument.name: start_time1
argument.display_name: Start time of preheating for the first season

argument.name: end_time1
argument.display_name: End time of preheating for the first season

argument.name: start_time2
argument.display_name: Start time of preheating for the second season (optional)

argument.name: end_time2
argument.display_name: End time of preheating for the second season (optional)

argument.name: start_time3
argument.display_name: Start time of preheating for the third season (optional)

argument.name: end_time3
argument.display_name: End time of preheating for the third season (optional)

argument.name: start_time4
argument.display_name: Start time of preheating for the fourth season (optional)

argument.name: end_time4
argument.display_name: End time of preheating for the fourth season (optional)

argument.name: start_time5
argument.display_name: Start time of preheating for the fifth season (optional)

argument.name: end_time5
argument.display_name: End time of preheating for the fifth season (optional)

argument.name: alt_periods
argument.display_name: Use alternative default start and end time based on the state of the model from the Cambium load profile peak period?
argument.description: This will overwrite the start and end time and date provided by the user
